intro: Trifolium campestre subsp. paphium, commonly known as the red clover, is a flowering plant in the legume family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pink or red flowers that are clustered in spherical heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. This subspecies is valued for its role in soil nitrogen fixation and as a forage crop.
